trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the Windows Store app project that you created when you completed the tutorial **Get started with Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the Windows Store app project that you created when you completed the tutorial **Get started with Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: In solution explorer, right-click the project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.
trans-unit.target: In solution explorer, right-click the project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Select the app that you registered in step 2, click **Next**, and then click **Associate**.
trans-unit.target: Select the app that you registered in step 2, click **Next**, and then click **Associate**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Repeat steps 4-6 to also register the Windows Phone Store project of a universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Repeat steps 4-6 to also register the Windows Phone Store project of a universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services**.

trans-unit.source: In the Services page, click **Live Services site** under **Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the Services page, click **Live Services site** under **Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Authenticating your service** and make a note of the values of **Client secret** and **Package security identifier (SID)**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Authenticating your service** and make a note of the values of **Client secret** and **Package security identifier (SID)**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do not share these secrets with anyone or distribute them with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share these secrets with anyone or distribute them with your app.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Push** tab and enter the **Client secret** and **Package SID** values obtained from WNS in Step 4, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Push** tab and enter the **Client secret** and **Package SID** values obtained from WNS in Step 4, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]When you set your WNS credentials for enhanced push notifications in the **Push** tab in the portal, they are shared with Notification Hubs to configure the notification hub for your app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]When you set your WNS credentials for enhanced push notifications in the **Push** tab in the portal, they are shared with Notification Hubs to configure the notification hub for your app.
